summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2019 between Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and video conferences for interviews with several individuals (referred to by initials or redacted names) as part of an investigation, with specific mention of a hearing before Judge Preska regarding document release issues in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney communicating with federal prosecutors to schedule interviews and video conferences for clients/witnesses, including dealing with travel and scheduling conflicts.

persons.name: David
persons.context: Mentioned by Sigrid McCawley as someone she spoke to regarding arranging a video conference interview for an individual returning to Spain.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: Presiding over a hearing regarding document release issues in the v. Maxwell case, which affects McCawley's availability for scheduling.

events.title: Scheduled Interview Meeting

events.title: Preska Hearing

events.title: Discussion of Video Conference for Witness
events.description: McCawley proposes a video conference interview for a witness returning to Spain, with possibility of flying them back for further in-person meetings.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner, was actively coordinating with federal prosecutors in September 2019 to schedule interviews and video conferences for multiple witnesses/clients.
The correspondence references a hearing before Judge Preska concerning document release issues in the v. Maxwell case, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to Ghislaine Maxwell.
Prosecutors were seeking to interview several individuals (referred to by initials or redacted names) who were apparently represented by McCawley's firm.
Travel complications, including a witness returning to Spain and a hurricane threat in Florida, impacted scheduling.
The emails demonstrate the logistical challenges and attorney-client coordination involved in federal investigations related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.
